ovdesc.p: The purpose of this table is to identify a specific group of customers which will then be cross-related to the Group Condition table, to define Securities safekeeping conditions applicable to that group. The Safekeeping General Condition record must exist before any associated group condition record can be specified. The key to this table is also the key to the associated Safekeeping Group Condition record.
The group of customers will be identified by means of the details held within this table.
For a customer to be selected, it must conform to every field value defined within the Safekeeping General Condition record to qualify for a specific group.
Amending a customer record may, therefore, result in reclassification of the customer into another group.

t.desc:
This field contains the actual value
If the associated PRTY.VALIDATION field on CONDITION.PRIORITY has been defined as a FILE>FIELD.NAME then the value entered must exist as a key on the file mentioned and the field name will be the enrichment for the VALUE field.
For example if ACCOUNT>CATEGORY is set in PRT.VALIDATION on CONDIITON.PRIORITY record , then the value input in this field should have an entry in CATEGORY file.
If the associated PRTY.VALIDATION field on CONDITION.PRIORITY has been defined as a @routine.name then this routine will be run to check if the value entered is valid.
e.g.
On the CONDITION PRIORITY record.
3.1 PRIORITY.ITEM is CUSTOMER>SECTOR.
4.1 PRTY.VALIDATION is SECTOR>DESCRIPTION
Then on XX.GEN.CONDITION record
2.1.1 ITEM is CUSTOMER>SECTOR.
3.1.1 PRIORITY is 1
4.1.1VALUE is 1000
Then the value 1000 will be checked against the SECTOR file and if there is record for 1000 then the DESCRIPTION will be displayed as an enrichment otherwise the value will be rejected with a record missing message.
Thus if the SECTOR code record was for Private Customers then
4.1.1VALUE is 1000
Private Customers
If the associated PRTY.VALIDATION field on CONDITION.PRIORITY has been defined as a @routine.name then this routine will be run to check if the value entered is valid. If not then the value will be rejected.
e.g.
On the CONDITION PRIORITY record.
3.1 PRIORITY.ITEM is CUSTOMER>SECTOR.
4.1 PRTY.VALIDATION is @ING.SECTOR.CHECK
Then the routine INFG.SECTOR.CHECK will be run to validate the value entered in the filed VALUE.

Identifies the General Condition details.
This code is also used to identify the condition in the Group Condition Table.

In addition to the numeric code , a date can be appended with a hyphen where a corresponding CONDITION.PRIORITY record with this date exists and this id should not exists in GEN.COND.KEEP field of CONDITION.PRIORITY
Input is Mandatory Three numeric characters formatted with leading zeros.
when RECORD ID with date is input , corresponding CONDITION.PRIORITY record with this date should exists .
when RECORD ID with date is input , this ID should not exists in GEN.COND.KEEP field of CONDITION.PRIORITY record.
Describes the General Condition Code.
This description of the General Condition is used for reporting or enrichment.
Input is Mandatory upto 35 alphanumeric characters.
This is a No input field and will contain value from CONDITION.PRIORITY s PRIORITY.ITEM field.

This field will contain a valid field name with a file name ( seperated by a ' >' ) from which it is derived which is used to set priority condition. The entire multi value set of the PRIORITY.ITEM field from the CONDITION.PRIORITY record will be defaulted as values (sub values) in this field.

For example if CUSTOMER>SEC.TYPE.SAFEKP and ACCOUNT>SECTOR are the 2 multivalue set of values in PRIORITY.ITEM field in CONDITION.PRIORITY of SC.SAFEKEEPING file , then these values will be copied as sub values in this field as shown below.
2. 1. 1 ITEM CUSTOMER>SEC.TYPE.SAFEKP
3. 1. 1 PRIORITY 1
2. 1. 2 ITEM ACCOUNT>CATEGORY
3. 1. 2 PRIORITY 2
4. 1. 2 VALUE
